name: benschicker
text: The original flowchart. Must give Beef props for keeping on keeping on.

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, ghoti, alcxxk)

name: soticoto
text: Neither would you, with Judge Judy watching you.

name: long-eared_ronin
text: It's like looking in a mirror. And the contrast of the Philippe chart really elevates this in to "best of" territory.

name: overmedicated
text: A comment left by overmedicated was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by editrix, Lolsworth, Smallberries, riotdejaneiro, StoatLad, gothfae, goocifer, GMM, desdin0va, equinn2006, jay_wish, dullard, Howard, NDCaesar, Bungdeetle, Flaaron, waggawagga, luckypyjamas, BrianNotBrian, likeiwassaying, Hexjumper, Ciansy, prowle4763, scraggg, tovarich, echidnaboy, Sabacc, Rakadin, SaurKraus, sminniha, wehavemagnums, fortunagolde)

name: thegreatestcape
text:
I'm assuming the lames are for the fact that the way your post is worded it seems like you want Beef's babies which have been arseraped, when I imagine what you in fact meant to say is that you want the babies he would have after being arseraped by you.

To be perfectly honest, I am not quite sure which is worse.

name: overmedicated
text: 2 years ago, I was 17. And therefore an arse.

name: zapatos
text: but now you are 19 and an even larger arse.

name: overmedicated
text: Actually I've lost weight.

name: kahrytes
text:
Yes!
Hi!

name: tellumo
text: A comment left by tellumo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Vondicus, Howard, jls8510)

name: zeroasalimit
text: Phillepe has the best flowchart ever. I'm tempted to apply it to my life.

name: zapatos
text: Hi!

name: tripleg
text: Yes!

name: cbtbone
text: Because of a problem?

name: zapatos
text: Hi!

name: tripleg
text: Yes!

name: ethelthefrog
text: I know days like this.  I know days and days.

name: hellofyellin
text: Chubby just for your python handle.

name: lizjones
text: Hell yes!

name: ethelthefrog
text: Thank you, good sir.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Eating spoons of peanut butter because it is the only thing in the house that doesn't require preparation. Man has being depressed down .

name: unklmnky69
text: i ate peanut butter with un-separated, take-out chopsticks yesterday. they were from the delivery korean food the night before...thank god i still have 3 days before i have to take a shower.....

name: w_w
text: When I want peanut butter on a spoon, I have to go out and buy it. That's preparation in my book.

name: missdove
text: I too have done this when in a slough of despond. It does make you feel a little better. At least you did SOMETHING.

name: epicurus
text: Beef's is my favourite of the flowcharts, but for me 60% of this strip was the Philippe, which I am all about.

name: closefriend
text: The scary thing is, if you track my progress from age 5 to now, it's like Philippe's chart magically fading into Beef's.

name: epicurus
text: That is so true of me as well that it frightens me.

name: fattybeaver
text: A comment left by fattybeaver was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by phthoggos, CottonPluff, Gompo, equinn2006, catgrl131, Johnfen, tropicana)

name: semiquaver
text: Yeah that is true of all of us dogg we are on the internet.  It is not a thing we need to mash out.

name: soticoto
text: Hence the avatar.

name: spinynorman
text: That ain't magic, that's just life.

name: click
text: If i weren't so cheap, i would buy the strip

name: nbgreene
text: oh just print it off onto white construction paper and fake sign it and throw a frame around it. i hate myself.

name: ajordan
text:
"Just online but definitely not like books"

*sigh*

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text:
that woman is hell of terrible.

i'm not ashamed to say that hell of, hella and such as have gradually crept into my vocabulary. i think everyone just thinks i'm a little touched.

name: cryabetes
text: well they're definitely picturing a small apartment decorated with owl posters.

name: tellumo
text: Me too, but then again I live in the Bay Area. Although I imagine Achewood alone would have been enough to start me talking like a dude from Circumstances who grew up in San Carlos or wherever.

name: confusion
text: Me three, and I take hell of flack for it even though I'm from here.

name: quinlaenar
text: MY ANUS IS BLEEDING

name: philosophe
text: such as meaning things like is hell of awesome!

name: catwoman153
text: I said hells no the other day.........

name: honesttom
text: Both my flatmates are huge Achewood fans, so with nobody to stop us and say, "Sorry, what is 'wicked sack'?" we're developing such as an Achewood-based dialect.

name: jackparsons
text: Everyone has redeeming qualities. Judge Judy had a Johnny Rotten case. Is on youtube.

name: upsilon
text: My God, me too. I try not to use 'hella' too often around friends, but whenever I do, they just pause and look at me with mild bemusement.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Muppets for snacking only, no full meals.
(I can not pull them off quite so well, but it doesn't stop me.)

name: grtfldvr
text: Me too!  Nothing new, alas - they already believe I'm one hella freak here in the conservative Midwest cornbelt.

name: laserblade
text: I've started replacing "does not" with "ain't".

name: zapatos
text: "Hell of" has replaced "many" and all such synonyms in my daily vernacular.  I find my life better for it... Hell of improved.

name: edana
text: We got hell of eggs in the fridge! T come make us a fritatta!

name: zapatos
text:
I went to breakfast with some friends, whom I had not seen recently, and one ordered a fritatta. I laughed and pretended to pull my head off.

I was not understood.

name: 1000hz
text: OH WELL

name: plezure
text: Where is self pleasure?

name: nutmeg
text: :D philippe! i want a philippe.

name: trollcollins
text:
Roast Beef is probably my favourite character. This flow chart helps me to explain why!

The contrast with Phillipe is just the cherry on top of the comedy sundae (comedea sundae?)

name: notgodot
text: I've had days exactly like his. Beef, anyways. Philippe's too gosh darn happy.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Am I craving Chinese food because I'm dying?

name: riazm
text: My sister printed out this strip and blue tacked it to her wall and way day my mother found it. She didn't understand it was a joke and thought it was an actual flow chart designed to gauge depression.

name: winkmartindale
text: Beef should know better than to read the online news.  That stuff is hella bad for depression.

name: honesttom
text: If you put these flowcharts in sequence, you've got a pretty good guide to manic depression.

name: confusion
text: Yes.

name: fermatprime
text: Hi!

name: mountaindewtab
text: this is perfect

name: domini
text: no matter what way things go, beef must eventually try and open the blinds.

name: soticoto
text: Chubby for your avatar alone.

name: edana
text: Not if the shower light is burnt out then it is just...oh well.

name: fjak
text: this is so depressing :(

name: slalvation
text: This freaked me out the first time I saw it. He knows about the peanut butter!

name: tbtabby
text: Fine by me, as long as he doesn't buy into that "proof against evolution" crap.

name: slalvation
text: Huh?

name: tbtabby
text: Creationists have claimed that peanut butter disproves evolution because life doesn't spontaneously form in it.

name: slalvation
text: Wow. That sounds like that magazine I read where they were saying that rivers running through canyons prove intelligent design because "why wouldn't they just go AROUND the mountains?"

name: zapatos
text: Fuckin'... RAIN!

name: ethelthefrog
text: Rivers are so ditzy like that.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Then again, they also think that bananas are proof of creation because they fit so well in your hand.

name: gsail11
text: This is the first strip I gave a five before I finished reading. Probably because I spent about ten minutes considering all the possible routes of Roast Beef's day.

name: paco
text: No matter what, you start at the same point and end at the same point. This flow chart could be simplified to "ARE YOU DEPRESSED?" "OH WELL"

name: tbtabby
text: Look closer. You can also end up with "AT LEAST TRY TO OPEN THE BLINDS."

name: lawbot
text: This is my brain.

name: szensky
text: I have never gotten at all choked up because of a flow chart before.

name: ctaronno
text: This one was hell of hard to read, but completely worth it.

name: dasuta
text:
If only I could give this multiple 5's.
Onstad is a master of comedy.

name: atticusonline
text: Hi! I am Philippe! Yes!

name: deus
text:
OH MY DEVILS!
THATS ME!

This flowchart is about ME! ONSTAD this is me!

name: keir
text: I would want one of these with my name on, but then I quit computer science and did something less soul crushing.

name: evilbobikus
text: The worst days are the ones where I have to tell my own internal monologue to stop yelling at me.

name: tad-
text: Philippe's decision-making chart is the same thing if you're on heroin too, I think.

name: ethelthefrog
text: Maybe that's what I need to try for my depression.

name: redphillip
text: I think this was the strip that led me to describe my status as 'Roast Beefy' for quite a while.  When I respond to personals profiles online, I try to hide this part of my reality, and rely on the Philippe technique:  HI!  YES!  Sometimes it works.

name: berami
text: Roast Beef's expression breaks my heart.  He's know he's got depression, but thats just the way it is. Oh well.

name: ishuta
text:
roats beff is like the ultimate loser

no wonder so many losers relate to him.

name: mctanuki
text: I wish there were a way to rate a strip at a 6.

name: greenkoolayd
text: oil on top?  why would he have that natural peanut butter?

name: fatcat
text: That's the best kind!

name: thaes
text: If everyone followed Philippe's flowchart, world would be a better place. Or at least, a cuter place.

name: duperando
text: My favorite part? The complete contrast between Roast Beef's drawn-out struggle and Philippe's 2-step flowchart of happiness and sunshine .
